page.title: 20Poynton Station continued
page.content: They are an enthusiastic team. The station has won First Prize in British Rail (Manchester Division) for cleanliness and tidiness each year from 1979 until 1983 when this award was no longer presented. The station has displays of railway memorabilia which include metal advertising signs typical of the 1930's. It has hand-trucks, milk churns, old-fashioned wicker hampers and trunks displayed on the platforms. Leading Railwayman Glyn Derbyshire has played a key role in collecting these items. He has three large albums of black and white photos showing Poynton Station in the days of steam trains. His enthusiasm has aroused a great deal of local support from the public. There has been T.V. and newspaper coverage of his efforts to make Poynton Station a living museum.
